text:
At a point in time, the nominal exchange rate $1.416/euro suggests that in order to
purchase one euro's worth of goods and services in Euroland, the cost in U.S. dollars will
be $1.416. As time passes, the real exchange rate tells us the dollar cost of purchasing
that same unit of goods and services based on the new (current) dollar/euro exchange
rate and the relative changes in the price levels of both countries.
